title: If you're running away, stop trying to save someone who's about to die by attacking the enemy.
body:
It's better to let 1 person die than having the whole team die.
I've gone from Bronze to Diamond and I swear that's the biggest problem I've seen in bronze/silver/gold

replies.body:
See, thing about bronze is, down here they will blame you for not trying to save them and go AFK as a result.

And I don't ever feel like fighting a 4v5.

When I support:

*Two teammates and I are ambushed by four enemies after taking an objective. Being Annie at the time, not my main support, I charge up my passive and do a QUADRA-stun! My teammates, with high mobility and damage champions, take that opportunity to make the best play ever. They high-tail it through our jungle and type "sorry" as I get cc'd and 100-0 for my efforts.*

This is why I jungle.

See, if I was in your situation and my quadra stun saved the lives of my two teammates, i'd be super satisfied about that. 

The only situation where that would frustrate me was if the enemy team was low after my burst and my team clearly had the damage potential to clean up but chose not to. 

If there was only a 50/50 chance they'd win though, or even a 60/40 chance, i'd be perfectly okay with them running. 

Different between a jungler and support mindset I guess.

Oh I used to be a support main.

That little story was, well not to QQ, just a quickie about abandonment. I sacrificed myself to save my friends, but the pain still hurts. A support's job is not an easy one, and it takes a strong heart to bear it.

I also prefer jungler because mid and top lane get lonely, so I like to keep them company with my pink tent! :D

I hate to watch a fellow champ die.  So I will often times die with them.  I know I shouldn't, it is a reflex that I am working on, as support.  Sometimes you just have to recognize a bad investment and cut your losses.  You just always think, there is that chance I could play this perfect and save them and get them the kill as well.

I think that's the mindset every player has; a sense of being "cocky".  Everyone thinks they're invincible, but in my opinion, League is less about skill and more about numbers.  Whoever has more gold or more champions will usually win.

I think it's situational, I was playing rammus and the ADC Graves was almost dead being chased by Zed, both of us were really low health. I decided to powerball and turn around into Zed, and Graves got the kill
As hard as I try to sacrifice myself for the team as tank or support, someone always has to follow me despite having pinged retreat thousands of times.

been there.
Done that.

Worst part about playing Leona.
They *ALWAYS* follow. :/

Seeing as your E pulls you into the fray, can you really blame them?
But seriously, yeah, it's pretty annoying when you do the "I'LL SAVE YOU" plays, and then they come back to help kill, and end up dying.

When it's 2v3 and they have less than 100 health.

Yes. I really can.

I added on to my message before you replied, and I totally agree.
Full AP Leona Mid (with RoA)  is fun, try that :)

I tried that a season or two ago.

AD bruiser build is a lot stronger (my opinion). Especially with her 4 instant AA combo.
E => AA => Q => AA => Hydra.
E resets her AA timer and Q resets her AA timer twice (On activation and when Proc'ed).

Full build she can Beat even Jax (1v1). Though you have to time your CC perfectly to disrupt his skills. Which is incredibly difficult.

I did AP Leona Mid twice, and it was hilarious... It definitely depends on who you're up against.
When I was against Xerath once, I accidentally gave first blood to Poppy and my top lane friend gave her a double kill... and she still couldn't do anything against him (he was Darius) and then I was able to kill Poppy 1v1 later on...
1st time was against Nidalee and Rengar Jungle... Let's just say I got first blood and then Rengar gave me another kill by coming by mid to say "hi".
I should try that AD Leona thing sometime, sounds definitely fun and useful

"Never leave a man behind"

This does not apply in solo queue.

The good stay bronze, thus is the circle of life.

That's bad advice.  I mean it really depends on the elo you are in, if you are in low elo ya run but if your in higher elo and know the people you are playing with aren't retards and will turn on that guy and help you kill him then do it.

The biggest thing I noticed in low elo is people who are gonna die anyways don't turn around and do damage and get the enemy low so your team mates can clean up- Most the time people who have no chance of getting away keep running and do no damage to someone and it's pointless because if you know your dead anyways u might as well at least lower their health for your team.
But if you feed with them, they won't report you later on for "letting them die".

> stop trying to save someone who's about to die by attacking the enemy.

**LET FEAR**
{{champion:266}} 
**BECOME FURY**

Be Maokai, dive into the fray with my hyper tankiness to buy time for team to retreat
Zed follows me in
GOD DAMNIT

As a friend of mine always says when he does something clearly stupid.

"I outplayed myself."

As support there are times that bot lane does not do well. If, there is someone on our team that is really fed i will try my best to

1: get both of us out of there safely 

2: get my teammate out and I stall to my death
Truest statement i've ever seen. 10/10
